title: Green electricity won’t help with pollution disparities
description: US minorities are exposed to more pollution. Most climate plans don't change that.

title: The Atlantic tropics are on fire—it already looks like August out there
description: Tropical Storm Bret has formed, and Cindy may not be far behind. It's June.

title: Apple releases visionOS SDK to developers and details testing process
description: Dev kits, in-person labs, and more will enable developing for unreleased gear.

title: After porn-y protest, Reddit ousted mods; replacing them isn’t simple
description: Replacement volunteers have big shoes to fill.

title: Amazon named its “labyrinthine” Prime cancellation process after Homer’s Iliad
description: FTC: Amazon tricked users into buying Prime and made canceling a Homeric ordeal.

title: Could these marks on a cave wall be oldest-known Neanderthal finger paintings?
description: It's even more evidence that Neanderthals could think symbolically, create art.

title: AI-generated Secret Invasion intro angers Marvel artists and fans alike
description: Marvel artist: "Unethical, dangerous, and designed solely to eliminate artists' careers."

title: Amazon’s allegedly “dangerous and illegal” warehouses spur Senate probe
description: Amazon has until July 5 to answer for its "abysmal safety record."

title: Get your first look at the OnePlus V Fold, thanks to render leaks
description: We were expecting an Oppo-style foldable, but this looks like a Samsung phone.

title: Who are the “Kia Boyz”? How TikTok fueled an epidemic of car thefts
description: Tens of thousands of Kias and Hyundais have been stolen for social media cred.

title: Musk refused to pay annual bonuses promised to Twitter employees, lawsuit says
description: Lawsuit: Workers relied on promise of bonus when opting to stay after Musk buyout.

title: Hurricanes push heat deeper into the ocean than scientists realized, new research shows

description: Metal Gear, Batman Arkham series also get Switch releases this fall.

title: Here’s how Ferrari designed a car that won Le Mans on its first attempt
description: The technical director for the Ferrari 499P tells Ars about returning to Le Mans.

title: Camera review site DPReview finds a buyer, avoids shutdown by Amazon
description: Amazon layoffs were supposed to shut down the 25-year-old site back in April.

title: Beyond missing Titanic sub, handheld gamepads are a common military interface
description: US Army, NASA, and more piggyback off years of familiar game controller design.

title: Drones take to the waves: Saildrones are getting data where people can’t
description: They can monitor the Antarctic year round and sail straight into hurricanes.
